perturbation.original_text: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term. Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 45 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.
perturbation.changed_text: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term. Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 30 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.
perturbation.explanation: Section 7.2.1 originally requires invoices to be paid within 45 days. Changing this to 30 days while other sections may assume the 45-day term introduces a contradiction and ambiguity regarding the payment deadline. For instance, late fees may have implicitly relied on the 45-day period. This creates uncertainty in enforcement as it is unclear which deadline applies.
